page.title: 07LIVING IN A RURAL AREA
page.content: Modern farming methods and increased mobility have had the greatest impact on this area in recent years. The traditional market gardening has all but disappeared, as has the small mixed farm. Very few orchards or plum plantations remain. In their place are huge fields which do not have the attraction of the jigsaw effect of the small fields dotted with cattle and sheep. In them giant machines work miracles of transformation at peak harvest times. Housing in the villages is of a wide and varying type, catering for the needs and demands of all classes. The area contains thriving village communities. Churches, two schools, modern public houses and a host of village organisations catering for all ages. All these offer the promise of a secure future for the villages.
